epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_id: QLD - Acacia Ridge - Climate Active - QE322E
product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) exceeding 0.1%
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation when physical not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

lca_information.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
lca_information.core_processes: External transportation of materials; manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing); treatment of waste and wastewater
lca_information.downstream_processes: Distribution of concrete mixes; installation on site; wastage of construction products; transport and treatment of waste at end of life
lca_information.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected during deconstruction; delivery distance assumed due to lack of primary data

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not considered in this EPD

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate can replace virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (2023)

contact_information.company_address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
